semantic_title: Bone Versus Joint Coding Guidelines for Musculoskeletal Conditions
section_path: Section I > C. Chapter-Specific Coding Guidelines > 13. Chapter 13: Diseases of the Musculoskeletal System and Connective Tissue > a. Site and laterality > 1. Bone versus joint

content.full_text: For certain conditions, the bone may be affected at the upper or lower end, (e.g., avascular necrosis of bone, M87, Osteoporosis, M80, M81). Though the portion of the bone affected may be at the joint, the site designation will be the bone, not the joint. (Evidence: pg no: 61, L27, L30-L31)
content.summary: When bone conditions affect areas near joints, the site designation should be the bone, not the joint (Evidence: pg no: 61, L30-L31)
key_concepts: Bone versus joint designation (Evidence: pg no: 61, L26)
